circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This victim was found by a fisherman in Bull Shoals Lake. The Location on the lake where victim was found is known as Howard Creek Arm near the Marion/Baxter County line. There was a bicycle found in close proximity to where the body was found. A backpack was also found with the bicycle and in the backpack contained a receipt to a mall in Phoenix, Arizona for walkman radio and a key to a Greyhound bus terminal locker. It is not confirmed whether or not these items are related to the victim.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This victim was hitch hiking and picked up in Louisville, Kentucky by another male subject enroute to Houston, Texas. They stopped for breakfast near Benton, Arkansas and after began driving again. The other male subject became tired and let the victim drive. The other male subject reports that he awoke and the cab of the vehicle being driven was filling up with water. The other subject got out but victim did not. This victim was under water for about 15 to 30 minutes. The victim was extracted from the vehicle and taken to the hospital where he expired 2 days later. This victim is possibly from New Haven, Connecticut traveling to California at the time.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This victim was a passenger in the front seat of an Intrigue Sedan which was involved in an accident striking a power pole. This started a natural gas fire destroying vehicle. The driver reportedly escaped and ran from scene. Vehicle was pulled away and the victim was found slouched over in passenger seat. A bystander, Israel Gonzales stated that his uncle, Juan Herrera (55 yo) had gotten into the front passenger seat of a vehicle just like the one involved in the accident at around 4:00 am. The bystander is no where to be found at this time. It is possible this bystander and victim are undocumented in the United States.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This skull was recovered from a deceased veteran's home in the 80's. The subject was in possession of the skull and had it displayed in his home. Once the subject died, the skull was discovered and sent to the Coroner's office where it remained for many years until 2010. The skull was never submitted to the Medical Examiner.

But it is believed to be in Pine Bluff, Arkansas between June 3, 1983 - June 11, 1983.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This decedent was reportedly one of three individuals who boarded a transit bus in Fayetteville, Arkansas, at a homeless shelter. Bus driver was alerted that decedent was ill and needed to be taken to the hospital. The bus proceeded on its route and the other two individuals got off bus at a stop without decedent. The decedent was found unresponsive in his seat and EMS called. This decedent was in possession of a fraudulent ID.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Approximatley 2:45 am witnesses stated they observed a house fire approximately one mile from their home. Police were called at 3:05 am. At 8:50 am one witness had gone by the burned house and observed what he thought to be a body. The occupant of this above residence was found at another residence. It is unknown who was in the burned house. Anthropology report could not determine ethnicity or sex because the bones are to badly fragmented and burned.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: This mandible and maxilla was originally sent to the University of Arkansas back in 1999. In 2008 when I went to the U of A to obtain numerous unidentified cases, this case was included. This mandible and maxilla has no original case number. This case was issued a new number for submission to UNT for Anthropology, Odontology, and DNA.
